STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 8, 2023
Michelle Lynn Carlton
Child Safe Michigan Judson CS
4410 W 13 Mile RD.
Royal Oak, MI, 48073-6515
RE: License#: CB630369213
Dear Ms. Carlton:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 6/6/23. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Linda Tansil, at 248-860-0787.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
Pontiac, MI 48342
brownp2@michigan.gov
(248) 860-3012
CC: Susan Salhaney

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for
each child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal
and at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
One of six foster care cases reviewed, (fifteen updated service plans), one
service plan dated 6/4/2022 – 9/1/2022, approved on 9/5/2022, was three days
late.
REPEAT VIOLATION FROM RENEWAL DATED 6/7/21; CAP
RECEIVED ON 6/17/21.
REPEAT VIOLATION FROM INTERIM DATED 8/18/22; CAP
RECEIVED ON 9/8/22.
FOM Policy 722-08D Required Signature.
Treatment plans Agreement and Signature
Once completed and approved, the caseworke
must obtain signatures from the following
individuals, as applicable: Foster parents relative

caregivers, and unrelated court ordered caregivers
Parents/legal guardians, youth, and caregivers
must check yes or no for the following wh
signing treatment plans: I have participated in
the development of the Case Service Plan and the
Parent Agency Treatment Plan.
Five of six foster care case files reviewed were in noncompliant. In these five
files, eleven of eighteen parent agency treatment plans were not timely, not
signed or the boxes on the reports were not checked within the thirty day time
frame.
One youth treatment plan dated 6/4/22 -9/1/22, the foster parent signed the report
on 10/10/22, the caseworker mailed the PATP to the parent on 10/4/22.
Same youth report dated 9/2/22 -11/30/22, foster parent signed the report on
1/4/23.
Second youth report dated 12/14/22 – 1/6/23, foster parent signed the report on
2/9/23.
Third youth report dated 11/16/22 – 2/13/23, youth and foster parent signed the
report on 3/22/23. No boxes were checked.
Fourth youth report dated 1/14/23 – 4/13/23, foster parent signed the report on
4/16/23.
Same youth report dated 12/15/22 – 1/13/23, foster parent signed the report on
2/20/23.
Fifth youth report dated 7/7/22 -10/4/22, foster parent signed the report on
11/15/22.
Same youth report dated 10/5/22 – 12/22/22, foster parent signed the report on
1/10/23.
FOM Policy 801 – 03 M edical Passport
All medical information within the medical passport
must be current and updated at least quarterly to
reflect the child’s current and completed health
information.
Two of six foster care case files did not have current and complete health
information documented quarterly on the medical passports. One medical
passport was last dated on 9/7/22 and the second medical passport was
last dated on 8/1/22.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
Rule 400.12311 Foster parent training
It was suggested to the agency to use the DHHS form 1798 for foster
parent/agency agreement opposed to the form the agency utilizes for their
agency accreditation.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No Consultation was provided.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. Interim
Evaluation. The CAP was approved on 9/8/22, was a result of the 8/18//22 interim
review. The agency had four violations. During this renewal evaluation only three
violations were found. Only one was a repeat violation. Overall, the agency has
decreased the number of violations and has shown improvement in several areas.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The CA reported that due to extenuating circumstances specific workers
performance, or issues with the way MiSACWIS reports data caused the repeat
noncompliance’s. She reported the team holds monthly “barrier busting,”
meetings where the supervisors discuss issues and identify and implement
solutions. The CA reported that there have been massive staff changeovers
however, most positions have been filled. She reported there are two new foster
care supervisors hired and they have been working with the prior corrective action
plan with the staff. She reported the biggest challenge has been making sure the
workers find the time to input data and contacts into MiSACWIS. She said moving
forward, training of staff is occurring, and the agency is utilizing time management
for completion of required workload. Staff are also working with smaller workload
numbers.
Financial Overview

The agency provided their annual budget. A copy of the nonprofit tax return from
the previous fiscal year was also reviewed. The agency also presented their
annual audit, and it was reviewed.
Staff and Youth Interviews
The staff interviewed all reported that there have been a lot of
staffing/supervisory/administrative changes over the past year which resulted in
several changes to the agency processes. The staff interviewed reported they feel
supported and feel encouraged with the recent changes.
There were no youth interviews.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency appears to have adequate space and equipment. Case files are
stored in locked rooms/cabinets which prevent unauthorized access.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There was one Safety Alert.
Concern: Unable to verify the upstairs section of the bedroom for safety due to the
door being locked which is occupied by the owner of the home who has two dogs.
There was no way to verify if there was a working smoke detector. Resolution:
Caseworker went to the home on 5/9/2023 and was allowed to view the upstairs
space. The upstairs required some cleaning but, a working smoke detector was
observed. The caregiver reported that the youth in the home never goes upstairs,
and she was planning to move from the home on 6/1/23. The caseworker went back
to the home on 5/12/23 and provided the caregiver with a safety plan that included
the youth not having access to the upstairs as well as a plan to provide current
vaccinations for the dogs. Photo of the smoke detector was taken and uploaded with
this safety alert.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that Child Safe Michigan Judson CS will be issued a renewal of
their regular license.
6/8/2023
_____________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
6/16/2023

Linda D Tansil Date
